docTitle.titlePart:
Synthesis and Characterization of a Purely Inorganic Open-framework
Bimetallic Phosphite with Intersecting 12- and 16-membered Ring Channels

byline.docAuthor: Gaijuan Li a , Yan Xing a, *, Yunling Liu b , Xianchun Liu a , Ning Xu a , and Shuyan Song a

byline.affiliation:
a College of Chemistry, Northeast Normal University and b State Key Laboratory of Inorganic Synthesis and
Preparative Chemistry, College of Chemistry, Jilin University

front.note: Received October 14 th , 2007; accepted November 14 th , 2007.
front.div:
Abstract. A new three-dimensional open-framework cobalt-zinc
phosphite [Co(H 2 O) 4 Zn(HPO 3 ) 2 ] · H 2 O (1), has been prepared un-
der hydrothermal conditions and characterized by single-crystal X-
ray diffraction, XRD, IR and SQUID magnetometer. The com-
pound crystallizes in the triclinic space group P1 ¯ with a 񮽙 7.552(5),
b 񮽙 7.671(5), c 񮽙 9.443(5) A 񮽙 񮽙 88.538(5)°, β 񮽙 89.109(5)°, γ 񮽙
87.056(5)°, V 񮽙 546.1(6) A ˚ , Z 񮽙 2. The structure of 1 consists of
corner-shared (cs) four-membered-ring chains formed by alter-
nating ZnO 4 tetrahedra and HPO 3 pseudopyramids, which are
further linked through CoO 2 (H 2 O) 4 octahedra giving rise to a
three-dimensional (3-D) neutral open-framework with intersecting
12- and 16-MR channels. The synthesis of system required the pres-
ence of L-histidine which is not incorporated into the structure of
the product. It is noteworthy that compound 1 represents the only
known example of purely inorganic open-framework cobalt-zinc
phosphite.
front.keywords:
Keywords: Hydrothermal synthesis; Open-framework; Cobalt-zinc
phosphite; Magnetic properties
